summary: the aim of this study was to evaluate the presence of respiratory viruses in the lower airways of individuals undergoing invasive mechanical ventilation. the study was to evaluate the presence of respiratory viruses in the lower airways of individuals undergoing invasive mechanical ventilation, with and without acute lower respiratory infection. this study suggests the presence of common respiratory viruses in the lower respiratory tract without causing symptomatic infection. this may have important implications on the interpretation of the results on the diagnostic setting.
